subject: Japanese Adjusted Current Account (JPY)(Jul) 1.48T vs. Exp. 1.56T (Prev. 1.76T)
Japanese GDP Price Index (Q2 F) Y/Y 0.1% vs. Exp. 0.1% (Prev. 0.1%)
US officials state Syrian President Assad has approved gas attack in Idlib according to WSJ, while reports add that Trump has not decided whether to target Iranian or Russian forces aiding Assad
PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: NAB keeps mortgage rates on hold despite rest of the big 4 hiking rates
content:
AUSTRALIA

Ausdrill (ASL AT)
- Co. announces that take up rate for its retail entitlement offer was around 86%. (Newswires)

Brickworks (BKW AT)
- Workers at some of the Co.’s manufacturing sites are planning to conduct industrial action over negotiations for a new enterprise agreement. (Newswires)

CIMIC (CIM AT)
- Co. Thiess unit receives USD 190mln contract. (Newswires)

Investa Office Fund (IOF AT)
- Co. stated that Blackstone (BX) increased offer for the Co. is best and final in the absence of a superior proposal. (Newswires)

National Australia Bank (NAB AT)
- NAB (NAB AT) CEO said they will keep standard variable rate for home loans on hold as keeping rates on hold for longer would help customers more. (Twitter)

Insurers
- Australia’s insurance sector will be the focus of the next round of hearings at the banking royal commission which will resume today. (SMH)

Other News
- Australian PM Morrison was seen to be favoured over opposition leader Bill Shorten, according to a recent newspoll. (Newswires)

 

JAPAN

Hokkaido Electric Power (9509 JT)
- Power was restored to most of Hokkaido following the recent outage caused by an earthquake. (Newswires)

Toyota (7203 JT)
- Co. announced to halt 16 out of 18 full assembly plants on Monday after parts factory shutdown in Hokkaido due to earthquake last week. (Newswires)

Airliners
- Kansai airport began a partial resumption of flights from Kansai airport which was shut due to typhoon. (Nikkei)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Hyundai Steel (004020 KS) / Steel related
- South Korea's antitrust watchdog fined the Co. along with five other steelmakers a total KRW 119bln for colluding to fix prices of reinforcement products. (Yonhap)

Real Estate
- Real estate trust firms saw profits increase 17.6% Y/Y to a 6-month record high during H1. (Yonhap)

Other News
- North Korea held a military parade for the 70th anniversary of its Foundation Day in which no ICBMs were displayed and North Korean Leader Kim refrained from delivering a speech. (Newswires)

subject: CBS (CBS) confirms Chairman and CEO Moonves is to leave with immediate efferct and CFO Ianniello to be acting CEO, while CO. also confirms agreed with National Amusements to drop pending litigation
NAB (NAB AT) CEO says they will keep standard variable rate for home loans on hold as keeping rates on hold for longer would help customers more
New Zealand Manufacturing Activity Value (Q2) Q/Q 1.8% (Prev. 0.6%)
French police arrest knife attacker who wounded 7 in Paris, although judicial source says no initial sign attack is terror-related

Swedish PM and Social Democrat party leader Lofven says nothing will be determined this election night and that he will continue to work as PM until parliament vote, adds this should be the end for bloc politics regardless of final outcome
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights Include Japanese GDP; Chinese CPI & PPI
EU are reportedly preparing to give instructions to EU Chief Brexit Negotiator Barnier to help achieve a Brexit deal, according to FT
Sweden Liberal Party leader says wants an alliance government but will not happen by cooperating with the Sweden Democrats
analysis_details: - As a guide, the Liberal Party is part of the centre-right bloc The Alliance who were the opposition to the governing centre-left, while Sweden Democrats are the nationalist anti-immigration party which effectively became the kingmaker after a close election in which the main coalitions were near even and both failed to win a majority.

subject: US SEC says it is suspending trading in Bitcoin Tracker One and Ether Tracker One through to September 20th
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

US President Trump said on Friday that another USD 276bln China tariffs are ready to go added to the USD 200bln and that the fresh tariffs could be available on short notice, while he also commented that the USD 200bln in tariffs could be announced soon, depending on what happens. In addition, Trump stated the US is starting trade negotiations with Japan and that Japan knows it's a big deal if they don't make a deal. (Newswires)

Chinese Trade Balance (USD)(Aug) 27.91B vs. Exp. 31.79B (Prev. 28.05B). (Newswires)
Chinese Exports (Aug) Y/Y 9.8% vs. Exp. 10.1% (Prev. 12.2%)
Chinese Imports (Aug) Y/Y 20% vs. Exp. 18.7% (Prev. 27.3%)
 


UK

A draft Brexit plan proposed by Eurosceptics in the Conservative party includes significant tax cuts, a new military expeditionary and a domestic-built missile defence system, according to leaked documents. (Guardian)

Former UK Foreign Secretary Johnson attacked UK PM May's Chequers plan, which he described as the PM "wrapped a suicide vest" around the British constitution and "handed the detonator" to Brussels. (BBC)

EU Chief Negotiator Barnier was said to be open to discussing other backstops and are ready to simplify checks if needed, according to a transcript on Friday which added they should be able to "de-dramatise" the Brexit backstop. Barnier also commented that Ireland remains a crucial issue and that there will be no agreement if there is no operational backstop, while he added if there is no Brexit deal, there is no more discussion and no mini-deals in the case of a no deal. However, there were later reports that EU Chief Brexit Negotiator Barnier said ahead of the Salzburg informal summit of EU leaders, we are determined to work for an orderly withdrawal including Ireland's backstop and ambitious future relationship with UK, while he was also said to have told Austria's Chancellor Kurz that 90% of the Brexit treaty is now complete. (Newswires)
 

EU

Sweden election early results showed the governing Social Democrats and its centre-left bloc with 40.6% of votes vs. the centre-right alliance with 40.1% of votes, while the Sweden Democrats which are the nationalist anti-immigration party were seen to receive 17.8% of votes. Furthermore, the Sweden Democrat leader Akesson commented he is prepared to talk with all other parties especially with centre-right leader Kristersson. (Newswires)

EU GDP Revised QQ Q2 0.4% vs. Exp. 0.4% (Prev. 0.4%). (Newswires)
EU GDP Revised YY Q2 2.1% vs. Exp. 2.2% (Prev. 2.2%)


COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes Rig Count (7 Sep): Oil rigs -2 to 860, gas rigs +2 to 186, total rigs unchanged at 1048. (Newswires)

IEA Director Birol said EM crisis may impact oil demand but added that the IEA still expects robust oil production growth and tighter supply. Birol also urged producers to pump more oil to avoid higher prices, while he stated Saudi Arabia still has scope to raise oil output and that he sees more US oil pipeline capacity next year. (Newswires)

NHC stated that NOAA Hurricane Hunter finds Florence strengthening. (Newswires)
 

GEOPOLITICAL

North Korea conducted a military parade in which no ICBMs were displayed and North Korean Leader Kim refrained from delivering a speech. (Newswires)
 

US

US President Trump stated on Friday that the US are working on a deal with Canada and "will see if it is good", while he had also commented that Canada is moving along with NAFTA talks and we will see what happens. In related news, Canada's Foreign Minister Freeland said the US and Canada are both committed to work on NAFTA and that talks remain constructive but declined to say whether further NAFTA talks will be needed in the upcoming week. (Newswires)

NEC Director Kudlow said dairy issue continues to block a NAFTA deal with Canada, while he also stated that he likes the goodwill shown by EU and is mildly optimistic on talks with EU. Furthermore, Kudlow stated China has to show some action and that they will evaluate comments on USD 200bln China tariff list and decide on timing and rate. (Newswires)

Fed's Kaplan (non-voter, neutral) is not worried that raising rates three further times would invert the yield curve but stated an inverted yield curve could be a worry since it may impede credit growth, while Kaplan also commented that the FOMC will not need to make a judgement on whether or not rates will become restrictive until the middle of next year. Furthermore, Kaplan stated that the Fed ought to be moving towards neutral interest rate and raising rates 3-4 times over the next 9-12 months. (Newswires)

US Non-Farm Payrolls (Aug) 201k vs. Exp. 191.0k (Prev. 157.0k, Rev. 147k); 2-month (June-July) net revisions -50k
US Unemployment Rate (Aug) 3.9% vs. Exp. 3.8% (Prev. 3.9%)
US Average Earnings (Aug) Y/Y 2.9% vs. Exp. 2.7% (Prev. 2.7%)


MARKET RECAP

Stocks were hit in afternoon trade as US President Trump hinted that he could impose another round of tariffs on China, which saw the ES drop from around 2880 to 2867.50 and it moved sideways for the rest of the session. Traders have been on alert to the possibility of the US announcing $200bln of tariffs on China imports after the public consultation period expired on Thursday; Trump has suggested that a further round could be on the cards. In stock specifics, the defensive sectors (utilities and telecoms) were hit as Treasury yields rose after solid NFP data. Broadcom (AVGO) was higher by almost 7% after reporting decent earnings on Thursday AMC. Tesla (TSLA) was the worst performer on the NDX after further senior management quit the company, and as investors were concerned about the behaviour of founder Elon Musk after he was interviewed while smoking marijuana and drinking whisky on a internet talk show. SPX -0.2% AT 2872, DJIA -0.3% AT 25921, NDX -0.3 AT 7431.

The T-Note future was sold after a solid NFP print, where AHE rose more than expected, which pushed the future down from 120-04 down to 119-20; newswires reported that there was large put buying interest into the data in the TYZ8 contract. After the data, there was some stabilisation, with the Z8 contract trading between 119-20 to 119-23, though there was a bid after Trump threatened China with further tariffs, but even then, the move was faded as we approached the close. Despite yields higher across the curve, there was some narrowing between major curve spreads (5s30s -3bps, 2s30s -2bps, 2s10s -0.2bps). T-note futures (Z8) settled 17 ticks lower at 119-20+.

subject: US Energy Secretary Perry to meet with Saudi Arabia officials including Energy Minister Al-Falih on Monday
Twitter source reports that Citi has developed a new method to invest in cryptocurrencies citing Business Insider
